dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN COLOR: A FULL MOON shines over a picture-perfect Ameri town. PEOPLE, seen in SILHOUETTE, stroll past quaint shop whose signs promise RELIABLE APPLIANCES, WELL-MADE CLOTHE SOLID VALUES. A DINER has a neon sign that offers the "BE EATS IN TOWN". But something is wrong. The neon isn't lit Nothing in town is lit. Street lamps, windows, are all da TCHICK! KA-TCHICK-TCHICK. That DISTURBING SOUND continues Some of the PEDESTRIANS drift into "UNIONTOWN PARK", mill around a GAZEBO, where THREE "MUSICIANS" are struggling w a trombone, a saxophone, and a tambourine. They can't see make the instruments work, except for the tambourine play who is rattling out a few very unrhythmic beats. That's w that sound is coming from. TCHICK! KA-TCHICK-TCHICKY-TCHI A CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALS: The "MUSICIANS" are DEAD. So the "PEDESTRIANS". Flesh is rotting off their bones. The itself, which at first looked so perfect, is ROTTING TOO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to be us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They used to be us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Worried) They're learning how to be us again.                                                RILEY DENBO watches the town through binoculars. 32, made rugged by realities, he has a heart beneath his tough exterior. MIKE CONVERSE, 21, young and unseasoned, has th eagerness and passion of someone young and unseasoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: o way. Some germ or some devil got them things up and walkin'. But there's a big difference between them and us. They're dead! 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAD TEENAGE COUPLE walks hand-in-hand near the gas pumps of a defunct TEXACO STATION. The boy steps on the little that BINGS when a car pulls in. Out of the building comes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...AN ATTENDANT. It was once tall and handsome. Now his f is a wrinkled map of death. He has lost its left arm. Dri blood darkens the shoulder of its jump-suit, where the ar was torn away. A "TEXACO" PATCH tells us the Thing used t work here. Embroidery tells us his nickname was once "BIG DADDY". He goes to the pump and removes the nozzle. Turns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: if searching for a car to fill with gas. There is none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like they're pretending to be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that what we're doing, son?                        Pretending to be alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 THE SOUND OF GROANING WOOD as THREE heavily-armed GUERILL push a large CRATE over a PRECIPICE into a deep GARBAGE P below. FIVE SIMILAR CRATES lie amid the rubble. Insects BUZZ. RATS crawl. HUMAN SKELETONS, most HEADLESS, everywhere, no flesh left on their bones. Those with head show various wounds to their skulls. Except for one, whic ...suddenly, startlingly MOVES! Its bony arm reaches up f the bottom of the pit toward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...CHOLO DeMORA, a Latino in his 20s, handsome, roguish, confident...a bit too confident. He reaches over his shou and unstraps a CROSSBOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor bastard. WFFFFT! Cholo shoots the skeleton. His arrow goes complet through the WHITE SKULL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6 The doors of a beat-up WHITE MOVING VAN open. Cholo reach in, throwing back an oilcloth that covers ANOTHER CRATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whole lotta trash this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's life, brother. A whole lotta trash. As the men tip the crate onto a dolly, MAGGOTS are reveal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the darkness beneath, squirming in a POOL OF BLOOD. (What's in that crate?) 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RILEY and MIKE watch THREE DEAD THINGS lumber toward them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from the town below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know we're here. They can smell life. Smell blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8 THROUGH THE BINOCULARS: BIG DADDY replaces the nozzle in gas pump. Sensing something, it looks around. Up. His dea eyes lock on Riley's. Big Daddy grunts. Responding to him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9 ...the THREE DEAD THINGS move up the hillside with more determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glancing at Mike's guns) You any good with those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunno. It's my first trip. Never had to use `em before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I'm out here with a guy who can't shoot. Let's go. Mike stands, turns, and... ...is GRABBED from behind by a ZOMBIE! It's not one of th three they've been watching. This one wears the remains o CLOWN SUIT. Half its bulbous red nose has been eaten away Painted eyelashes make its stare alarming. Its ORANGE HAI crawling with SPIDERS. It wrestles Mike to the ground. Op its lipsticked mouth. Is about to bite Mike's neck when.. ...Riley FIRES his .45. BLAM! A bullet SHATTERS the Clown SHOULDER CAP. The dead thing is pitched backward, but see to feel no pain. It hunkers over Mike again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: iley FIRES four more times. THREE BULLETS RIP into the Clown's CHEST, NECK, CHEEK. Finally, the FOURTH PUNCHES A HOLE above the thing's left eyebrow. The Clown DROPS. ike looks at Riley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. You can't shoot, neither! 10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RILEY and MIKE step into a tight, uncomfortable space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Generators whir. Gears turn. The two men open a storage locker and strap on ammo belts as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...SOMETHING TERRIBLE LOOMS out of the shadows! It moves toward Riley and Mike, who can't see it from behind the locker. The LEFT SIDE OF THE THING'S FACE has been BURNED AWAY. Only scar-tissue remains, and a single usable eye bulging from a socket. Riley turns. Sees the thing. And, surprisingly, he relaxe recognizing CHARLIE HOUK, a heavily-armed guerilla whose intellect is as burned as his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tcha doin', Riley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Havin' a bad dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have bad dreams. Hell, yes. Just look at me, you can tell that I have terrible dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town is full of walkers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every town is full of walkers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These aren't just walking. They're like...regular folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're dumb, Riley. Hell, dead folks is near as dumb as me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You learned how to make yourself useful. That's what they're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dumped the trash. Cholo's on                       his way. Riley and Mike look across the room in the direction of t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: voice. Twenty feet away, a WOMAN sits at the controls of looks like a scavenged airplane cockpit that's outfitted a mixture of high- and low-tech equipment. She wears a bl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leather jacket with "PRETTY BOY" emblazoned across the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Surprised) Pretty Boy's a dame?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one is. Last one was a guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to him?                                   Pretty Boy turns, poking her finger through a BULLET HOLE encrusted with year-old BLOOD in the chest of her jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kept his jacket. For good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put some flowers in the graveyard.                      Pretty Boy reaches out and flips a toggle switch on the control panel. THOOMB! THOOMB! DEEP CONCUSSIVE SOUNDS can felt as much as heard as...

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11 ...RILEY, CHARLIE, and MIKE step out of A VEHICLE the siz of a city bus. The words DEAD RECKONING are painted on it side. This is no bus. It's a war wagon, built of SCAVENGE PARTS with a RIVETED STEEL SKIN. GATTLING GUNS protrude f a MEAN-LOOKING SNOUT. A ROOF TURRET supports two FOURTEEN INCH-CANNONS. Rotating lights SHINE in all directions, piercing the night. THOOMB! THOOMB! THOOMB! That sound again. MORTAR TUBES on vehicle's roof are launching FIREWORKS that BURST in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Looking up) `Flowers in the                            graveyard'. Why do you call `em that, Riley? I don't get it. These here flowers ain't the kind you lay down on the ground. These here are sky flowers. Way up in Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love ya, Charlie. Know why? Cuzz you still believe in heaven. THE WHITE MOVING VAN rolls in and parks beside Dead Recko

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHOLO jumps out with the THREE GUERILLAS from the dump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys scope out the town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like nobody's hit it before. FOUR GUERILLAS get into an old T-BIRD CONVERTIBLE mounted machine guns. TWO OTHER ARMED MEN climb onto MOTORCYCLES. very night seems to GROWL as everyone starts their engine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always ready. Just look at me ou can tell I'm always ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look at you, all I see's an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's all you see. bet you see this iron, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie is wearing four holstered sidearms, two shouldere automatic rifles, a REMINGTON...and a sly smile that make wonder whether he's an idiot or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go have some fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't about fun, Cholo. VROOOM! The T-Bird and the motorcycles pull out toward to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go in, do our job, and get out, all of us alive, okay? I don't want                      any fuck-ups on my last day out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Grinning) My last day, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: iley looks surprised. Cholo mounts a MOTORCYCLE, REVS the engine, and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he do, hit the lottery or somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin'. (Wondering) Somethin'. Riley and Charlie start to get back into Dead Reckoning. follows, pausing to look up at the "sky flowers".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do those things really work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. (Almost sadly) Stenches can't                       take their eyes off `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 DEAD THINGS stand completely frozen in the middle of main street, like statues, mesmerized by the FIREWORKS. Only one figure is moving. BIG DADDY. He weaves between h brothers and sisters, urgently waving his one good hand, like Frankenstein's monster, as if to say "Bad! Bad!" He learned that fireworks bring danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DEAD TEENAGE CHEERLEADER, holding filthy pom-poms, look Big Daddy, unable to grasp what he's trying to communicat A SPEAR is DRIVEN through the Cheerleader's face! The spe is held like a lance by HARRY, a guerilla who roars past his motorcycle hooting like a cowhand on round-up. Other BIKERS rumble down the street, firing guns. Big Daddy watches the Cheerleader fall. It throws its hea back and lets out a great HOWL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13 THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: RILEY recognizes BIG DADDY from t gas station. He also recognizes the Thing's anguish as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 ...DEAD RECKONING, mortars still shooting FIREWORKS, stop the edge of town. CHOLO pulls up alongside on his bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: RILEY and MIKE watch the T-BIRD R down MAIN STREET. The FOUR GUERILLAS inside laugh gleeful as they use the MACHINE GUNS to MOW DOWN HAPLESS ZOMBIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was gonna be a battle. This is a fucking massacre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Through an open hatch) Kid, these are the toughest guys in the `hood. You can't keep `em from wantin' to get some chuckles. iley gives Cholo an irritated look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, not me, Boss. You told me not to have any fun, I'm not having any fun at all. (To Mike) Come with me, kid. I'll show you the ropes.                           Mike climbs out and gets on the back of Cholo's motorcycl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get supplies. Essential supplies. That's job our job, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 THE WHITE MOVING VAN pulls up to a supermarket. THE DEAD THINGS in the parking lot, gazing at the FIREWORKS, barel notice the vehicle. MARKSMEN keep the lot covered as GUERILLAS carry CASES OF CANNED GOODS out of the supermar and into the van. The team has this down to a science. ILEY'S VOICE comes over one Guerilla's hand-held radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into his radio) Lousy, but there's lots of it. 17

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAD RECKONING RUMBLES down a side street, its steel skin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reflecting the FLASH of fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 PRETTY BOY drives. RILEY stands beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into radio) Number Two, what's your location?

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: rug store. Need an aspirin? I got a million of `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into radio) Antibiotics. We need                        antibiotics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into radio) Number Three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19 UERILLAS load boxes of ammo into a JEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into radio) Guns and ammo, Boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 HARRY, the biker with the spear, is making another run to a WALKER, who stands mesmerized by the fireworks, when... WHAP! Harry is sent FLYING! DEAD WOMAN, once pretty, wearing a softball uniform that bears the NUMBER NINE, has used its bat to hit a home run Harry's riderless motorcycle fishtails up the street and the side of a building. arry tries to get up. TWO DEAD THINGS attack him. Another motorcycle, driven by ANCHOR, who looks like Popeye, RUMB up in the nick of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, jump on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting off the Dead Things, Harry gets on and speeds aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 PRETTY BOY turns a corner. Out the windshield, RILEY sees 22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...CHOLO and MIKE, on Cholo's bike, joining up with FOXY,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: red-haired guerilla on his own motorcycle. The three driv toward the end of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 23 CHOLO SCREECHES to a stop at a LIQUOR STORE with MIKE and FOXY. All dismount and start toward the entrance. They st as DEAD RECKONING pulls up and RILEY and CHARLIE climb ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' in there but booze. Booze ain't essential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jug of good Kentucky goes for fifteen hundred back in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Cholo) I'm not risking anybody's ass just so you can pick up some side money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not askin' you to. Cholo and Foxy start into the liquor store. The doors are wide open. All that can be seen from outside is darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike! Wait!                                              But Mike has followed the others inside. 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4 CHOLO unstraps his crossbow and leads the way cautiously into the dark space. Every subtle SOUND in the SILENCE pu MIKE more on edge. His hand tenses on his gun as SHADOWS in front of him. Shadows that could be zombies, but are n Behind the dusty glass doors of a once-refrigerated wall- unit, Cholo sees a CASE OF DOM PERIGNON. He goes to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: refrigerator. Re-strapping his crossbow, he opens the doo Reaches in for the case of champagne. His two hands grab

dialogues.speaker: A THIRD HAND GRABS IT
dialogues.text: Cholo looks up. The refrigerator has no back wall. A DEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THING with a Manson-like SWASTIKA tattooed in the center its forehead has stepped in from the shadows of a loading area beyond. It GRABS Cholo with a terrifying GROWL. Cholo falls under the weight of the champagne, and the weight of the Dead Thing, which drops on top of him. They

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: roll, struggling. The Thing holds Cholo in a death grip. At the front of the store, Mike fumbles with his rifle. Foxy shoots at the Dead Thing and misses. Cholo PUNCHES the Thing with his free hand. The Dead Thin head recoils, but lowers again toward Cholo, the Swastika looming, drooling teeth baring for a bite. Cholo's eyes flash. It's the first time we've seen him scared. BLAM! CHARLIE FIRES one round, right into the center of t swastika on the Zombie's forehead. The Thing crumples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shootin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good shootin'. Ain't no such thing                       as nice shootin'.

dialogues.speaker: R
dialogues.text: o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FOOT KICKS the Zombie off Cholo, who looks up to see... ...RILEY extending a hand to help him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still here, ain't I?                                Everyone relaxes. Cholo picks up the case of Dom. The oth head toward the front of the store. TILT DOWN TO THE FLOOR as their feet move past. In the gl behind stacks of cartons... ...A DEAD HAND appears. Reaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Look out, kid!                                    The hand grabs Mike around the ankle! Mike turns, raising gun. Too late. A DEAD UNIFORMED POLICEMAN, the skin on half its face STR DOWN TO BONE, RIPS A HOLE IN HIS LEG with its teeth! ike SCREAMS, staggers into a wall, and drops to a seated position on the floor. Riley and Charlie spin around at t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sound of his cry. Cholo, closest to Mike, pulls his cross and fires an arrow through the Zombie's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' rookies. Cholo tucks away the crossbow, grabs a box of Cohibas off counter, and runs outside with Foxy. Riley goes to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Kneeling) It's alright, son. You're gonna be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm dead. You get bit by one f those things and you become what they are. Riley wraps a strong arm around Mike and lifts him. Mike quickly plants the barrel of his .45 under his chin and..

dialogues.speaker: BLOWS HIS OWN BRAINS OUT
dialogues.text: iley, stunned, lets the corpse slide to the floor. He loo into the rookie's open eyes, devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 THE WHITE MOVING VAN, THE T-BIRD, AND THE JEEP roll out o town in a convoy. Trailing them, THREE SADISTIC GUERILLAS MOTORCYCLES ROAR past, firing... ...a HAIL OF BULLETS at A DEAD FAMILY on the sidewalk. Th MOTHER FALLS. Not shot. It has been GRABBED and SHOVED do to the ground by... ...BIG DADDY! Who GRABS the little GIRL next, thrusting h roughly behind the protection of a wrecked car. The FATHE last. Big Daddy grabs it from behind, by its hair, just a ...ROUNDS from an UZI DRILL A DOTTED-LINE across the Fath neck. Big Daddy is unhurt, but spattered with BLOOD. Not greenish-black. The blood of the dead.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: here's a RIPPING SOUND as the Father's NECK is PULLED APA by the weight of its limp body. The body DROPS to the str

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HEAD remains suspended in Big Daddy's hand. His face contorts. His mouth opens and closes, trying to utter sou ig Daddy drops the head, looking down at its befuddled ey with sympathy. After a moment, the sympathy is joined by rage. Big Daddy lifts his right foot and brings it STOMPI DOWN on the disembodied head, CRUSHING ITS SKULL. The convoy ROARS off, leaving a cloud of exhaust. Big Dad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sees Harry's downed motorcycle lying in the street. The b of an AUTOMATIC RIFLE protrudes from a saddlebag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Daddy goes over. Pulls out the rifle. Tests the weigh it in his hand. Curls his finger in through the guard and pulls the trigger. BLAM! A bullet ricochets off a brick wall. Big Daddy is startled at first. Then, he relaxes, realizing the rifle' power. With surprising dexterity, he slings the weapon's strap over his head and across his chest, patting the str as if comforted by it. Turning, he looks toward... ...THE DISTANT GLOW OF A SKYSCRAPER that can be seen ON T HORIZON. That's the direction the convoy is headed. That' where the bad men came from. That's where he wants to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the city in the distance, Big Daddy starts walking. NUMBER NINE falls into step beside him. Soon there are MO None of them knows where they are going. Or why. All that seems to matter is that they have a leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26 DEAD RECKONING, emitting tendrils of HOT STEAM from twent steel nostrils, stands parked in a corner of a fenced-in outdoor yard. (We don't see how big the yard is. Yet.) A SEARCHLIGHT sweeps the darkness as GUERILLAS unload the supplies they took from Uniontown and carry them toward.. ...a set of RUSTY STEEL DOORS, above which is a FADED SIG that reads "SUBWAY (TO CITY)". In the bustle of activity, HARRY, the biker who was attac in town, perspires as he helps unload. He looks ill. RILEY walks past, handing out bottles of beer to the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry. Beer? Harry doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry?                                                   Harry SPINS! GROWLS! LUNGES at Riley like a beast! Riley has no time to reach for his gun. The Harry-Thing i strangling him. SMASHING the neck of a beer bottle on the snout of Dead Reckoning, Riley JAMS THE JAGGED GLASS into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Harry-Thing's forehead. Its body drops to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got knocked off his bike in town. Must have been bit.                                      Riley looks down at the body with a mixture anger and reg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 A mile-long subway tunnel extends into BLACKNESS. A wide PLATFORM runs the length of the tracks, at the head of wh A DERELICT TRAIN is parked. A CARGO CARRIER pulls out, driving along the platform, it flatbed piled with supplies, while ANOTHER CARRIER is bei loaded with boxes of food, pharmaceuticals, ammunition, a TWO BODY BAGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit happens, Riley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Blaming himself) Only if you let it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cargo carrier that was first to pull out drives into tunnel. CEILING LIGHTS spaced far apart STUTTER on and of Two guerillas, ANCHOR and MOUSE, who looks like a mouse, on the open flatbed with the cargo. The tunnel is filled with looming steel shapes that cast menacing shadows. Mouse shifts nervously. Suddenly... ...PLINK! SOMETHING WET FALLS ON HIS FACE! He JUMPS. Recovers. Wipes his cheek with his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate going under the fuckin' river. He takes out a joint. Lights up. The match FLARES. SPLAT! Mouse and the match are soaked by WATER dripping from abo 28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIVERS flank a TRIANGLE OF LAND where A CITY glows in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sunrise. Once proud and prosperous, its buildings now see like tombstones. SEVEN BARRICADED BRIDGES span the rivers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protected on three sides by mighty                      rivers, the city stands as a monument

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to man's ingenuity. At the center of it all is Fiddler's Green.                              29

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TV MONITOR broadcasts views of A KITCHEN, A PLUSH LIVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROOM, A DEN with a VIDEO FIREPLACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luxury living in the grand old style.                   Dine at one of three restaurants. Look for that perfect gift in our fabulous shopping mall. he monitor shows a huge ATRIUM with shops and restaurants

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make it sound nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is nice.                                             Holding his case of Dom Perignon and his box of Cohibas, CHOLO looks with FOXY at a monitor mounted to a white-til subway station wall. Down the tunnel behind them, the oth GUERILLAS unload supplies from CARGO CARRIERS parked on t platform. A sign reads, "GOLDEN TRIANGLE/FIDDLER'S GREEN"

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Approaching) Cholo.                                    Foxy moves away, leaving Riley and Cholo alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two people dead. That kid, Mike. He                     should be here with us right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill him. He got bit and he killed himself. Same thing I woulda done. And you! iley lunges at Cholo, takes hold of his shirt, and SLAMS him against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck are you turning into, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

He's just seein' that we get a few cheap kicks so we don't go thinkin' too hard about why he's eating steak and the rest of us are lucky to get the bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same question. Why you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found out I was working with Mulligan and his people. Tired of eatin' off Cbones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can you do? Every place is the                     same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Places with people. I'm gonna find me a place where there ain't no people. North. Canada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever you're going, take me                          ith you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't. Riley likes to be alone. He might take me. Cuzz havin' me around is pretty much the same as bein' alone. (Glancing at Riley) can make myself useful. And I an shoot. C S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can shoot. And I can be pretty fucking useful. I had training. I was gonna join the Army. Up the Green. Till somebody figured I'd be a better hooker than a soldier. RILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to hear your story. Everybody's got a story, and I'm tired of hearin' them all! SLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your story, Riley? They look at each other, clearly attracted. R                                             ILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said everybody has a story. That was wrong. I don't have one. Daddy was a preacher. Mama kept the house. School. Engineering. Nothing bad ever happened to me...(turning away)...till everything changed. LACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything changed for all of us. Whether we had a story or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SOUND outside the window. Charlie glances through the b CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Riley and Slack look out the window. FOUR SECURITY MEN ar chasing MULLIGAN into the alley outside. They drive him l an animal against a wall, club him, and drag him away. RILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulligan. RILEY instinctively reaches through the window's bars, bu there's nothing he can do. It's a helpless feeling. HARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they gonna do? Kill him?                       SLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not right away. First, they'll try                      to get what they can out of him.                        About people like me.                                   Riley puts his hand on her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: g t

dialogues.text: We're taking the truck out. Get he guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not him. Just the regular uys. Know what I mean?

Tony's arms w wildly, like a giant zombie, comic yet oddly unnerving as BLAM! BLAM! Bullets hit it in the face and neck. GUS, a y soldier, and his partner BARRETT, are shooting outside th SALES OFFICE of the car-lot-turned-depot. A sign is print on the window. "BEST DEALS IN TOWN AND THAT'S NO BALONEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47 The steel doors under the "SUBWAY" sign open and CHOLO st out with his TEAM. A DEPOT GUARD steps forward as the doo close and lock automatically behind them.

dialogues.text: What's up, Cholo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Flashing an official-looking paper) Takin' the truck out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just got back in this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody gets a day off these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Taking Cholo's paper) Hey, wait a                       minute this is from yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Keeping his cool) Oh, I must have                       given you the wrong one. Here... Cholo reaches down, but not into his pocket. For his gun. Just before he draws it...SHOTS ring out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. Just target practise. 48

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double or nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. GUS aims his rifle at the jerking head of TONY BALONEY. A is about to fire, there's a SOUND at his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit scratching around back there. You're tryin' ta fuck up my aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just standin' here. I'm not doin' nothing. The SOUND comes again. From the woods that adjoin the lot Barrett grabs the handles of a KLIEG LIGHT mounted on a p and swings it so that it ILLUMINATES the tree-line.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: here's nothing there. Nothing but BRANCHES being slapped erratic gusts of wind. Barrett pivots the Klieg light back to its original posit jumping out of his skin when the bright white beam reveal A DEAD THING within arm's length. 5

dialogues.text: Barrett FIRES! The dead thing DROPS OUT OF FRAME, REPLACE ANOTHER. BLAM! Barrett SHOOTS again. This creature collap It is also replaced by another, which is also shot, as... BLAM! The top of Barrett's head is taken off by a rifle s The rifle was fired by BIG DADDY. The barrel is still smo In the darkness behind him stands NUMBER NINE. Behind Num Nine are the SHUFFLING SHADOWS of many more dead things. GUS SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? Screaming practice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stenches! Jesus! They're all over the place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DEPOT GUARD turns and runs toward his men. CHOLO'S TE unstraps weapons and gets ready for battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Stopping them) Ain't our fight.                         Stenches are making it easy for us.

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: Let's grab the truck. HOLO and his team sprint across the lot to DEAD RECKONING

dialogues.text: A GUNNER at a machine-gun battery opens fire on the WALKE Many of the rounds SPARK off the wire fencing. 0

dialogues.text: CHOLO and his TEAM scramble into the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we send up some `sky flowers'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Those things want to get in here...let `em in.

dialogues.text: 51 THE WALKING DEAD march through MACHINE GUN FIRE behind th "leader". BIG DADDY. He is the first to reach the fence surrounding the lot. Pushing against the wire, he is soon joined by NUMBER NINE. Then OTHERS. The FENCE COLLAPSES. Dead Things SWARM into the depot. VROOOM! DEAD RECKONING pulls out. Rumbling over the secti of fencing the zombies pushed down, it drives into the ni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS abandon their stations and scatter, shooting wil NUMBER NINE knocks one of them cold with its baseball bat The soldier falls, losing his M-16. BIG DADDY grabs the b and throws it aside. Picking up the soldier's M-16, he presses the weapon into Number Nine's hands, even arrangi Number Nine's fingers on the trigger. RATATATAT. With the gun aimed at the ground, Number Nine fires a BURST that sends her into a spastic dance. The soldier sits back up. Draws a pistol. Big Daddy grabs the barrel of the still-firing M-16 and guides it along the pavement to... ...the soldier's legs. Bullets march up his groin, belly, chest, and, finally, head. He drops. ANOTHER SOLDIER attacks. This time, Number Nine aims her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: weapon purposefully and scores a direct hit. OTHER DEAD THINGS SMACK at the steel doors that lead down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a GRUNT from Big Daddy, who is gazing toward the GLOW the FIDDLER'S GREEN HIGH-RISE across the river, closer no than before. The city. That's where he wants to be. That'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where he's determined to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone call, sir.

dialogues.text: Thank you, Knipp. I'll take it. Knipp brings a radio-phone to the table. Kaufman picks up receiver and lifts it to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: aufman? Kaufman tenses, just enough for Sutherland to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. The one that got away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said we should talk when I was less excited. I'm a lot less excited now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Mister DeMora? 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't have a place in the Green,                fine. I'll go find another place.                 But you know what I'm gonna need?                 Money. I want my money out of your                bank. And I want the rest of the money out of your bank. And if you don't give it to me, I'm gonna blow you out of your fuckin' ivory tower. I've got Dead Reckoning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's unfortunate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the money on a boat and send it across the river to the South Side. Tenth Street Pier. One man to drive the boat, no more. You've got till midnight. Four hours. I won't be there. Dead Reckoning won't be there. But I'll know if it happens. I'll know if it doesn't happen. CLICK! CHOLO hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a world where the dead are returning to life, the word `trouble' loses much of its meaning. (Beat) He wants money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't negotiate with terrorists. There are other options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55 CLANG! A FIDDLER'S GREEN SECURITY GUARD opens a cell door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one of you is Denbo? RILEY, CHARLIE, and SLACK exchange glances. What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Denbo. Come in. Can I offer you a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then...please sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody else is sitting. I think I'll just stand here, like the rest of you. While you tell me why I'm standing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need you to repossess a vehicle that belongs to us. The vehicle you designed, Mister Denbo. Dead Reckoning has been stolen. By your second in command. I want him captured. Or killed. And I want my two-million-dollar piece of equipment returned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which has guns. Big guns. That could do a great deal of damage if he were to aim them at this city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just send out your troops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to lose them. I could send five hundred men against that thing and they'd all come back in body bags. It's your vehicle. Cholo was your man. You might be able to get close enough to...do what has to be done. (Refilling his scotch)                    Do this for me and I'll grant you                     something in return. Residence in                     the Green.                                            RILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me. That's what Cholo wanted,                     and you didn't give it to him, did                    you? That's why he's out there                        waving a cannon at your ass.                          Kaufman won't admit that Riley's right, but he looks at h with a glimmer of respect. RILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me one of those vehicles, over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the depot, weapons, and enough ammunition to go north. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the idea. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. You've named your price. An easy one to pay. R ILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more thing. My friends. They go with me. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them. e looks at Riley, a hint of desperation behind his eyes. KAUFMAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: an you find Dead Reckoning? Quickly? RILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How quickly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a way.

dialogues.text: from under the toppled car. He lumbers down the embankment. Pushes on one of the uptu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: K C

dialogues.text: Better'n you. The safety's off. he Soldier checks the gun. The safety is off. He clicks it on and embarrassedly hands the weapon to Slack. RILEY

dialogues.text: SLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: 2 The steel doors to the subway tunnel open. RILEY and his step out. The depot has been DEVASTATED. FIRES BURNING. FENCES DOWN. Only TONY BALONEY moves, still waving spooki

dialogues.speaker: O

Just as he tosse it to Riley, they hear...GROWLING! he team draws their weapons, standing in a loose circle, their backs to each other, guns searching for a target. Darting eyes peer into the void. MORE NOISES emanate from somewhere. Everywhere. Slowly... ...Charlie unstraps his Remington. Licks his thumb. Wets sight of the rifle. LACK

dialogues.text: ff-center. But I got him. The Thing relaxes its grip and drops at Slack's feet. ANOLETE

dialogues.text: I can't see! Riley pulls out a flashlight and shines it under the dash he team fans out around the T-Bird. The smoke is so thick they can't make out anything. Including each other. harlie peers into openings that shift on the breeze. What he doesn't see, what he can't see, is what's behind him.. ..a FEMALE WALKER, wearing the soiled and tattered remnan of a bridal gown. The fabric seems to glow in the smoke. The bride shuffles toward CHARLIE. We see it coming. No o else does. Just as it opens its mouth to bite... BLAM! Slack SHOOTS! Her bullet cuts closer than the one Charlie fired, CLIPPING OFF THE TOP OF HIS EAR before

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even-Steven. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not! That hurt! I didn't hurt you! Manolete fumbles with colored wires under the dash. RILEY

dialogues.text: Fifty thousand in Mexico. R

dialogues.speaker: I GOT IT
dialogues.text: Riley leads the team into the T-Bird. Manolete starts to out from under the dash. As TEAHOUSE settles into a seat the door... ...SOMETHING heavy and wet SMACKS his shoulder. It's a FOREARM! It drops onto Teahouse as if thrown at him. TEAHOUSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God! Oh, GOD, WHAT'S THIS?! Teahouse HURLS the bloody thing onto the asphalt. Shockin the ARM SPRINGS BACK, THUMPING against Teahouse's face! A twist of torn muscle, no thicker than clothesline, is kee the limb loosely attached to... ...A DEAD THING that has crawled beside the T-Bird. Lifti itself, it BITES a large filet out of Teahouse's arm. CHA

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: SHOOTS it. anolete climbs up behind the wheel and...VROOOOOM!...peda to the metal he pulls out of the depot. Slack glances at Teahouse, then, wind in her hair, leans in close to Riley SLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Softly) How long does he have? RILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a brother. Real brother, by birth. Bit. Hung on for six days. Before he turned. I was the one had to shoot him. SLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you said nothin' bad ever happened to you. RILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That happened to my brother. SLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into his eyes) But you kept going. ILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: up. Dead is dead. And that ain't you. And that ain't me. Slack turns to Teahouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: orry, man. I truly am. She draws her .45, aims at Teahouse, and FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 KAUFMAN paces with a cigar, passing SUTHERLAND, STYLES, and CLIFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I recognize that some of you are concerned. We've been threatened by a disgruntled employee. I've sent people out to take care of the problem. However, should something go wrong, I want to assure you that measures have been taken. I've established outposts. With food and supplies to support us on our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On our way? To where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alternate sites have been chosen. Air transport has been arranged. For us and our families. As well as necessary support personnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about all the others? Kaufman looks at Cliff, as if expecting him to understand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the others can be replaced. y others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff, let me talk to you for a moment. Kaufman leads Cliff into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...an alcove on the far side of the room, shutting two po doors made of sandblasted glass. Sutherland and the other can't hear, but can see, Kaufman and Cliff in SILHOUETTE. ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DOORS: Kaufman leans close to Cl smiling, his eyes blinking a bit too rapidly. KAUFMAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You interrupted me. I was just                          talking about how people can be replaced. You don't want to be replaced, do you? CLIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous) No. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, and I don't want to replace you. You have promise. A day may come when you earn yourself some responsibilities. Right now, the responsibilities are mine. All                          the responsibilities. It was my

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ingenuity that took an old world and made it into something new. I                       put up fences to make it safe. I                        hired soldiers and paid for their training. I keep the people on the streets away from us by giving them their games and vices. It costs me money! But I spend it because the responsibility is mine! Now do you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: understand "responsibility"? CLIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but... KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No buts. CLIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... Kaufman looks disappointed. Taking Cliff by the arm, smil again, he leads him over to an outer door and opens it. A armed SECURITY GUARD stands in the corridor outside. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him out with the rest of the garbage. I won't be needing this man anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the conference table, Sutherland sees the light coming from the outer corridor, better defining the silhouettes the Security Guard drags Cliff away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Styles) Pretty soon it's going to be one of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 n an overgrown suburban street, a LAWN TRACTOR, driven by GARDENER in work clothes, drives back and forth, back and forth, over a swath of dead grass. The gardener is DEAD t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 67 CHOLO watches the GARDENER through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't have this truck, I'm no different to Kaufman than that poor Mexican bastard out there. CLOSE ON: CHOLO'S WATCH. 11:20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's never gonna pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows it's his ass if he doesn't. Cholo slides open a small window, grabs his crossbow, and SHOOTS the Gardener in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8 ANGLE ON: A SOLID WALL OF WOOD. BIG DADDY, NUMBER NINE, a OTHERS OF THE DEAD push against it. The wood holds. Big Daddy turns, surveying his troops. Focusing on the BUTCHER. On the meat cleaver it has in its hand. Big Daddy pounds on the wood, demonstrating. Points at th meat cleaver. Pounds again. The Butcher gets it. Approach the wall. HACK! The meat cleaver chops into wood, splintering it. REVERSE ANGLE: from the other side of the wall as the woo splinters to reveal BIG DADDY'S EYES staring through at.. ...the FIDDLER'S GREEN HIGH-RISE, looming closer than it before, though it's still across the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 CLOSE ON: a small, electronic unit, the size and appearan of a "Game Boy". AN LED SCREEN shows a BLINKING RED DOT moving along a MAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn left up here.                                     SLACK, driving the T-BIRD now, makes the turn. The car bl through a deserted town, moving fast. Riley notices that Slack is effected by the desolation she sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long since you been out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never been out. Lived in the city since...it was a regular city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Surprised) Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you were going to make yourself useful. Right now what I could use is for you to pull over. he does. The T-Bird stops along a road bordered by a MARS thick with tall CAT TAILS. Unexpectedly, Riley stands and points his automatic at PILLSBURY and MANOLETE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a deal with your boss. Find Cholo. I'm gonna do it. Keep him from                  blowing up the Green. I'm gonna do it, I don't want people to get hurt. Bring back Dead Reckoning... Sorry. That's where I stop. I didn't ask him                  for much, just guns, ammo, and a car. I've got the guns. I've got the ammo. And if I find Dead Reckoning I'm gonna have the best fucking car                        that's ever been built, and I'm taking it to Canada. If any of you don't like that idea... Riley reaches down and opens the passenger door. Manolete looks out and sees the CAT TAILS MOVING. THREE WALKERS ar slogging through the marsh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MANOLETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some choice. PILLSBURY

dialogues.speaker: G
dialogues.text: ood choice. I like see Canada. Pillsbury reaches out and slams the car door closed again ILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, keep these two covered. Charlie pulls his .45. Riley turns around his seat, glancing down again at the " Boy" in his palm. The RED DOT has moved on to ANOTHER MAP RILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a right onto Route Six. Slack pulls out. SLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what you were thinking about all along. You got me out here figuring I'm a boy scout, and now you're telling me we're just

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stealing a fucking car? ILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a problem with that? SLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I like the way you think. HARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the way he thinks, too. Just look at me you can tell I like the way he thinks. RILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take another right.                                     SLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know which way you're                        going?                                                  Riley holds up the "Game Boy". It BEEPS SOFTLY as the RED shifts onto another MAP. RILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I built a homing device into Dead                       Reckoning. If Cholo's anywhere within                   fifty miles, we can track him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 DEAD RECKONING stops on a long road, at the end of which stands... ...a MILITARY COMPLEX. THE BEAM of a SEARCHLIGHT sweeps b and forth over the buildings, a sign of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 CHOLO checks his watch. 11:29. He speaks into a TRANSMITT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse. Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOUSE stands in the shed, holding a transmitter of his ow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. No boat. No money. No nothing.                                                73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, he's never gonna pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why we're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHOLO looks out the window to the searchlight sweeping ov the military complex in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. IMPALA
dialogues.text: 74 SLACK drives as RILEY monitors his "Game Boy".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. He's going to Ross Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powder magazine. Where they keep                        the big boomers. Rockets. For Dead                      Reckoning's cannons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 MOUSE looks at a GRIMY WINDOW as the SHADOW of a WALKER s just beyond the glass. Mouse FIRES a BURST shattering the window and dropping the Walker. Silence. Mouse takes a tentative step toward the window. SCRATCHING SOUND. SOMETHING climbs up onto the sill from outside. Mouse raises his gun, but hesitates when he sees ...it's a child. A GIRL SCOUT. It died at age nine, still wearing its uniform. Now, it's voracious. It grabs Mouse' gun-hand. The weapon FIRES harmlessly into the floor. Mou is about to be chomped when... ...a STALAGMITE OF GLASS in the top of the shattered wind drops, PIERCING the Girl Scout's head. Mouse runs SCREAMING to the door, where he is grabbed by another DEAD THING. And another. As he is TORN APART, he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: that there are DOZENS MORE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: BIG DADDY. Only the river now flows between he his goal: FIDDLER'S GREEN HIGH-RISE, so near and yet so f 76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! The door SLAMS behind KAUFMAN as he enters the foye KNIPP emerges from the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word from Mister Denbo, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Pack us up. We might have                           to be leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the helicopters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll only need one of them.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. DEAD RECKONING
dialogues.text: 77 PRETTY BOY eases the vehicle up the road to the complex o buildings: ROSS PARK, a sprawling munitions depot. The searchlight continues to sweep across the night, but ONE is manning it. It's mounted to an automatic rotator o the roof of the main building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like no one's here.                               The gates stand wide open. There's no sign of life. CHOLO punches a button. The SIDE HATCH HISSES OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foxy. You're elected. Get out there and see what the fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foxy moves out through the open hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody go out and help. SCAR grabs his weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE OF THE DEAD TOPPLES face first into the water, droppi out of sight. ANOTHER FALLS. BIG DADDY looks at the spot where his brothers fell in. He looks for a long time, coc his head like a puppy trying to understand a high wind. The first Dead Thing slowly rises out of the water. Then Second. They stand, waist deep, in the shallows. Big Daddy gazes down at the water, a concept dawning. The with grim purpose, he steps deliberately off the low wall Hitting the river, he manages to stay on his feet. Standi waist deep, with the others, he scoops up water with his good hand. Sniffs it. Tastes it. He looks up. Sees the CITY LIGHTS REFLECTED ON THE RIVER. tries to express his thoughts. All that comes from his mo is a series of inarticulate moans. He's incapable of transmitting his idea. So he does what he's been doing si Uniontown. He leads. He walks toward the city. Out of the shallows. Into deep water. Over his head.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: 79 There are AUTOMOBILE TIRES, GARBAGE CANS, a rusted ANCHOR sunken MOTOR BOAT, HUNDREDS of BEER BOTTLES...AND THOUSAN OF DEAD THINGS...WALKING...ON THE RIVER BOTTOM...followin BIG DADDY through the debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 A knock on a door is answered by A MAN who looks a bit to greasy to be important. SUTHERLAND is outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is Kaufman paying you and                      your men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred a day. Each.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pay you five thousand a day. Each.                                                   81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car speeds down the road with SLACK at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 RILEY looks at his watch. 11:40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83 The unmanned SEARCHLIGHT scans the yard, casting intermit shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is important. The men                        here wouldn't just walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they had no choice.                               FOXY and SCAR move toward a large STORAGE BUILDING where door swings in the night breeze, SLAPPING alarmingly agai the wall. Beyond the opening is a BLACK MAW, like a velve curtain, past which nothing can be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There could be stenches in there. (Readying his M-16) Got a flashlight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scar nervously pulls out a flashlight. As he CLICKS on th BEAM, he loses his grip. The flashlight drops to the grou Scar reaches for it. His fingers tip it and it spins. The beam WASHES across his shoes. Then Foxy's shoes. Then fin ...ONE OTHER SHOE. Someone else's. Gasping, Scar grabs th flashlight, shining the beam up onto what should be a leg but there's nothing left above its bloody shin. PLIP! PLOP! PLIP! Beads of BLOOD hit the floor, dropping from the DARK FIGURE of a SOLDIER who is approaching. Sca aims the flashlight at the figure's face, recognizing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brubaker! You okay? Where's the                          other guys? What happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brubaker keeps coming. He has BULLET HOLES in his chest, they're not what's dripping blood. It's another half-eate FOOT that he's carrying. BRUBAKER IS DEAD. Foxy shoots hi Foxy and Scar move into a hangar-like space. Pitch black. Except for the mote-filled BEAM from Scar's flashlight, w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: illuminates a supply of enormous cannon shells, lined up storage shelves. THE "JOHNSONS". SIX DEAD SOLDIERS are hunkered in the shadows, EATING the REMAINS of OTHER DEAD SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foxy grimly raises his weapon. As he squeezes the trigger the sound of the gunfire OVERLAPS into... 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANCHOR and SCAR wrestle TWO "JOHNSONS" into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. That's all we need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sober) To blow up the Green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 THE T-BIRD rumbles along a road lined with large HOMES, o prized for their panoramic views. RILEY'S "Game Boy" BEEP The display shows the RED DOT moving along a MAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cholo's moving out. Looks like he's                      heading right for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley looks outside. Beyond the homes he can see THE CITY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hit. Off this hillside...they can shell the Green. Pull in! There! SLACK pulls into a driveway, stopping the T-Bird in the shadow of one of the houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hey'll be coming up this road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 In a walk-in STEEL-WALLED SAFE, KAUFMAN pulls out banded STACKS OF MONEY and stuffs them into TWO PRADA DUFFELS. 87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE HEAD RISES out of the river. It's BIG DADDY, rivulets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: water running down the creases of his face. Another head rises. And another. NUMBER NINE and the BUTCHER ZOMBIE. More and more heads break the surface. The water FILLS wi BODIES emerging from the deep. HUNDREDS OF THEM. The CITY LIGHTS REFLECT off their wet clothes as the ARMY OF THE D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: clambers up a boat ramp on the city side of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 RILEY and HIS TEAM wait in the shadows of the driveway th pulled into. They HEAR the distant GROWL of DEAD RECKONIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking over a hedge-row, Riley can see HIGH BEAMS advanc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the Others) Y'all stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're goin' out there alone? You                       need our guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead Reckoning's got steel skin an                      inch thick. You can't shoot your                        way in. I'm hopin' I can talk my                        way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna steal the truck and                          leave us here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley'd never do that. Just look at                      him, you can tell he'd never do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep an eye on the hatches. If I                         get in, I'll try to leave one open.                      Riley takes off. Charlie looks torn. He wants to go with Riley, but he has to keep PILLSBURY and Manolete covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like dat man. You go help `im.                         I take care of dis sissy. Pillsbury, moving fast for a big woman, POUNDS Manolete's temple with a mighty fist. He drops like a lead weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the roof opens and the GREASY MAN from "downt steps out of a fire stair with ANOTHER GREASY MAN. SUTHER remains inside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about this. I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leavin' people behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaufman was gonna leave people behind. So we're leaving him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greasy Men go trotting across the rooftop. As they cl into TWO HELICOPTERS, we realize that they are PILOTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 RILEY walks down the road. The GROWLING of the diesels is getting louder, the GLOW from the high-beams brighter. Ri is startled by a NOISE behind him. He whirls around and s CHARLIE approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's cool back there.                            Riley is about to object, when DEAD RECKONING comes rumbl around a corner a hundred yards down the street. Riley ch his watch again. 11:52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late to send me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put on your Sunday smile. Try to                        look friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am friendly. Just look at me you                      can tell I'm friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 91 In the cab, PRETTY BOY eases off the gas. CHOLO looks out windshield as the headlights strike...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denbo. And his idiot. (Beat) Stop.                      Gimme the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicle crunches to a stop forty yards away. Pretty Boy hands Cholo a microphone. Cholo speaks into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get up here, Riley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbed the T-Bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin' up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking you. With this. Riley holds up his "Game Boy". Cholo looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truck's got a little transmitter in her belly. Sorry I never told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were always a smart guy, Riley.                     Much smarter'n me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went and took off without                           inviting us along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't around to get invited.                      Anyway, I figured you wouldn't                          want in on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want in on anything you got goin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Pretty Boy) Open up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you, nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 92 SLACK and PILLSBURY watch from the shadows as a HATCH OPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 RILEY and CHARLIE step on board. PRETTY BOY is at the controls. FOXY, ANCHOR, and SCAR stand nearby. Charlie is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: grinning like a badly scarred Cheshire cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you so happy about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley told me to smile. So's you'd let us come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather have you in here than                         out there.                                               KA-CHUNK! Cholo lifts his crossbow, pressing a loaded arr up under Riley's chin. BLOOD TRICKLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the smart one now? Charlie is about to react when he feels Foxy's M-16 pokin into his back. Cholo looks into Riley's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you were gonna quit. Here you are still working for the man.                       Kaufman sent you out here, didn't                        he? To get the truck back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94 SLACK and PILLSBURY creep forward, freezing as they see RILEY with the crossbow at his neck. Slack aims her K-90 CHOLO, RUSTLING branches as she moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man pulls the trigger, he's                        dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 CHOLO cocks his head outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else is out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaufman sent some guys with us.                         We took care of `em. I know you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: been up to Ross Park. Picked up some Johnsons, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. Pretty Boy, set the cannons.                       96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With great WHIRRING SOUNDS, the vehicle's largest guns be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to ROTATE slowly toward the city across the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're running out of time here. C'mon, Riley. Make yourself useful.                     MANOLETE begins to stir on the ground beside THE T-BIRD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97 RILEY keeps cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, Cholo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaufman's got it coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98 SLACK and PILLSBURY watch THE GUN TURRET continue to turn the cannon barrels angling toward FIDDLER'S GREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99 PRETTY BOY lifts a clear cover off a RED FIRING BUTTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit the tower square, you'll kill a                      lot of innocent people. Miss and                         hit the city, you'll kill a lot of                       our friends. Your beef's with                            Kaufman, not them.                                       The turret on the roof GROANS as the cannons rotate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's killed a lot of our friends.                        Every week we took out the garbage,                      you and me. Every month I took out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaufman's garbage. People he wanted off the streets. He turned me into a                     goon and then he pissed all over me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foxy, keep `em covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 The turret stops, cannons aimed directly at the GREEN. 101

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHOLO moves to the RED FIRING BUTTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the smoke clears, I'm gonna

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: roll in, hit the bank, take the money, and pick up any other fancy                       shit I can get my hands on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There won't be any fancy shit left.                      And money burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not when you keep it in a safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102 MANOLETE pulls one of the MACHINE GUNS out of its mount o the T-BIRD. Shouldering it, he creeps toward DEAD RECKONI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 103 ON THE CONTROL PANEL: A CLOCK CLICKS DOWN TO MIDNIGHT. 4...3...2...1...CHOLO reaches down and pushes the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
